Jordan_McIntosh:
{{Short description|Canadian singer-songwriter}} {{Use mdy dates|date=July 2020}} {{BLP sources|date=May 2015}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Jordan McIntosh | image = | caption = | birth_name = Jordan James McIntosh | alias = | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1995|12|20}} | birth_place = [[Ottawa]], Ontario, Canada | death_place = | origin = [[Carleton Place]] | instrument = Guitar | occupation = Singer-songwriter | genre = [[Country music|Country]] | years_active = 2012–2017 | associated_acts = | label = IROC, Big Star | website = https://www.jordanmcintosh.com }} '''Jordan James McIntosh''' (born December 20, 1995{{cite web|title=Buzz: Jordan McIntosh|url=http://www.family.ca/buzz/jordan-mcintosh/|website=[[Family Channel (Canadian TV network)|Family Channel]]|accessdate=June 3, 2015}}{{dead link|date=November 2017 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}) is a Canadian [[Country music|country]] singer-songwriter from [[Ottawa]], Ontario.{{cite web|url=http://www.insideottawavalley.com/news-story/3869005-jordan-mcintosh-is-living-the-dream/|title=Jordan Mcintosh is living the dream|first=Tara|last=Gesner|date=June 27, 2013|publisher=}}{{cite web|url=http://www.cmt.ca/artist/jordan-mcintosh/|title=CMT.ca: Jordan McIntosh biography|publisher=}} He has released a number of singles. ==Career== He was born to Greg and Julie McIntosh in [[Ottawa]], Ontario. He has an older sister Melissa. He is presently based in [[Carleton Place]]. McIntosh's first single, "Walk Away", was released in August 2012, followed by "Let Me Love You", "Grew Up in a Country Song", "That Girl" and "[[Story of My Life (One Direction song)|Story of My Life]]" which featured [[George Canyon]]. He also was featured on Canyon's Christmas song "Home for Christmas", which also included [[Aaron Pritchett]] and [[One More Girl]]. McIntosh won Ottawa Idol (formerly called Kiwanis Idol) in 2011. McIntosh won the 2014 Country Music Association of Ontario award for Rising Star.{{cite news|last1=Gesner|first1=Tara|title=Country heartthrob Jordan McIntosh named CMAO's Rising Star|url=http://www.insideottawavalley.com/news-story/4573866-country-heartthrob-jordan-mcintosh-named-cmao-s-rising-star/|accessdate=June 3, 2015|work=Inside Ottawa Valley|date=June 12, 2014}} He was a finalist in the Emerging Artist Showcase presented by [[Sirius XM Canada]] at the [[Boots and Hearts Music Festival]].{{cite news|title=Jordan McIntosh to appear in emerging artist showcase at Boots and Hearts Music Festival|url=http://www.insideottawavalley.com/whatson-story/3898453-jordan-mcintosh-to-appear-in-emerging-artist-showcase-at-boots-and-hearts-music-festival/|accessdate=June 3, 2015|work=Inside Ottawa Valley|date=July 18, 2013}} ==Discography== ===Studio albums=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" |- ! style="width:10em;"| Title ! style="width:18em;"| Details |- ! scope="row"| ''Steal Your Heart'' | * Release date: April 15, 2016 * Label: Big Star Recordings |} ===Singles=== {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" style="text-align:center;" |- ! rowspan="2"| Year ! rowspan="2" style="width:20em;"| Single !
